H0.text: Weight is the property that best describes a material's ability to resist scratching.

H1.text: Flexibility is the property that best describes a material's ability to resist scratching.

H2.text: Length is the property that best describes a material's ability to resist scratching.

H3.text: Hardness is the property that best describes a material's ability to resist scratching.

A4.text: Scratch hardness is the measure of how resistant a sample is to fracture or permanent plastic deformation due to friction from a sharp object.

A5.text: The principle is that an object made of a harder material will scratch an object made of a softer material.
